result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovan Darnell Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovan Darnell Hayes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $357.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08/19/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 05/02/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs in the amout of $357.00 signed and filed. Copies given to the District Attorney, defense counsel, and the defendant.  Copy also given to the Clerk of Courts Office.

Defendant Jovan Darnell Hayes in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court ordered SENTENCE WITHHELD and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the 
following conditions:
 - Defendant is to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, condition time, STAYED and to be used at the agent's discretion.
- No possession of any guns or dangerous weapons. 
 - No CCW permit. 
 - Perform 250 hours of community service.
 - Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges during the first 9 months of probation or civil judgment.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jovan Darnell Hayes in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovan Darnell Hayes in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Gary Rosenthal, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $70.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 06-01-2015 and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:03 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jovan Darnell Hayes in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jovan Darnell Hayes in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
